DataElement.preferredName: Eligible 8/8 HLA Adult Matched Unrelated Donor Availability Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator related to whether or not an eligible 8/8 adult matched unrelated donor is available.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Eligible 8/8 HLA Match Adult Matched Unrelated Donor Availability
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion._Complete HLA matching for HLA-A, -B, -C, and -DRB1 loci._An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age._A donor who is not related to the transplant recipient, but who is a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Eligible 8/8 HLA Match Adult Matched Unrelated Donor
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.:Complete HLA matching for HLA-A, -B, -C, and -DRB1 loci.:An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.:A donor who is not related to the transplant recipient, but who is a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match.

Concepts.definition: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.
Complete HLA matching for HLA-A, -B, -C, and -DRB1 loci.
An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.
A donor who is not related to the transplant recipient, but who is a human leukocyte antigen (HLA) tissue type match.

Property.preferredDefinition: Available; obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 9/7/22 Released DEC per AK for COG cjl;

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
